description:
Ceres was a tennyo, a celestial maiden, who came down from the heavens to bathe in a stream. She hung her hagoromo (robe) on a tree nearby, which was her key to returning to the heavens. But the robe was stolen and the man who had stolen it forced her to become his wife, thus producing a family full of human and tennyo blood mixed.

Now, in modern day time, Aya Mikage is a descendent of Ceres, and has quite an amount of tennyo blood. On her 16th birthday, she and her twin brother, Aki, are thrown a party. At the "party", Aya's grandpa plans to kill her, for she has tennyo powers unlike the rest of the family, and can actually become Ceres herself and destroy the Mikage family. Aya, however, can switch back, so this transformation happens quite frequently.

With protector Yuuhi by her side, it is up to Aya to control Ceres and keep her from coming back, but her relationship with an ex-worker for her evil grandpa may be a distraction.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

name.native: アレクサンダー·O·ハウエル

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/wataseyuu_) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/wataseyuu) Identifies as X-gender, a form of non-binary gender identity in Japan, but prefers feminine pronouns in English. Watase started drawing manga at the age of five, and by the age of 17 she aspired to be a professional mangaka. She was bullied relentlessly from elementary school until high school, eventually culminating in a suicide attempt. These experiences were later used for scenes in Arata: The Legend. She credits her recovery to religion, as she is a member of Soka Gakkai, a Buddhist organization that promotes peace centered on respect for the dignity of life, and she often provide illustrations for the organization's newsletter. In 1998, Watase won the 43rd (1997) Shogakukan Manga Award for Ayashi no Ceres.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

Yuuji Nunokawa was a planner, producer, as well as the founder and representative director of [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/).

Worked at [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/) as an animator and director through the '70s before becoming a producer.
